edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.tasks
Class RationaleTaskList

java.lang.Object
  edu.wpi.cs.jburge.SEURAT.tasks.RationaleTaskList

public final class RationaleTaskList
extends java.lang.Object

This defines the domain model for the Rationale Task List. Unlike the initial example, we use a hash table rather than a vector since we need to be able directly access elements. This class is a Singleton (follows the Singleton design pattern). Yes, the constructor is SUPPOSED to be private! If you need a access to the table, use the getHandle method. This code is based on the Eclipse Corner article "Building and delivering a table editor with SWT/JFace" http://www.eclipse.org/articles/Article-Table-viewer/table_viewer.html and on the example attached to the article: (c) Copyright Mirasol Op'nWorks Inc. 2002, 2003. http://www.opnworks.com Created on Jun 11, 2003 by lgauthier@opnworks.com

COUNT

private final int COUNT

Constant Field Values

s

private static RationaleTaskList s
The handle to this static class

tasks

private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,RationaleTask> tasks
Our collection of rationale status elements. Unlike the table view example, we use a hashtable because we need to be able to add and remove specific elements as the status changes.

changeListeners

private java.util.Set<IRationaleTaskListViewer> changeListeners
The viewers that care if the data changes. We'll just have one viewer.

private java.lang.String makeKey(int id,
                                 RationaleStatusType status)
Define a unique key for our hash table element based on the parent's element ID and the type of status message

Parameters:
id - - the unique id of the rationale element the status is about
status - - the status type
Returns:
a key to the hashtable for that element

overrideTask

public void overrideTask(RationaleTask task)
Invoked when the user has indicated that a task should be overriden and no longer displayed. The task is updated in the database, removed from the status hashtable (which will alert the view), and the UpdateManager is used to tell the RationaleExplorer to not display the status icon in the tree

Parameters:
task - - the task being overriden.

taskChanged

public void taskChanged(RationaleTask task)
When a task has changed, we need to let the view know so it can update accordingly.

Parameters:
task -

removeChangeListener

public void removeChangeListener(IRationaleTaskListViewer viewer)
De-registers a view so that it does not need to be notified if something changes. Of course, we only have the one task list viewer...

Parameters:
viewer - 0 the viewer to remove

addChangeListener

public void addChangeListener(IRationaleTaskListViewer viewer)
Adds a new view. We will only have the one view.

Parameters:
viewer - - the view to add
